# cancel()

**Instance Method**

Changes the cancelled state of the receiver to indicate that it should exit.

## Declaration

```swift
func cancel()
```

## Discussion

The semantics of this method are the same as those used for [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Operation]. This method sets state information in the receiver that is then reflected by the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/isCancelled] property. Threads that support cancellation should periodically call the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Thread/isCancelled] method to determine if the thread has in fact been cancelled, and exit if it has been.

For more information about cancellation and operation objects, see [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Operation].

## Related Documentation

- **isCancelled**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver is cancelled.

## Stopping a Thread

- **sleep(until:)**: Blocks the current thread until the time specified.
- **sleep(forTimeInterval:)**: Sleeps the thread for a given time interval.
- **exit()**: Terminates the current thread.
